Don't edit this page, just click on the version number! --> | programming language = [[Javascript]]/[[XUL]] | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | language = Multilingual | genre = [[Download manager]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GPLv2]]<ref>{{cite web | url= https://github.com/nmaier/DownThemAll/blob/fe2740082649c24dae179751761953d4f07332eb/LICENSE | title= LICENSE | publisher =DownThemAll! team | date =2011-05-18 | accessdate =2011-05-20 }}</ref> | website = https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/downthemall/ }} '''DownThemAll''' (DTA) is a [[download manager]]/accelerator extension for [[Mozilla Firefox]], licensed under the [[GPL]]. It can pause and restart supporting downloads at any time, without losing data, and enables users to download all the links, images or embedded object contained in a webpage. Both [[HTTP]] and [[FTP]] protocols are supported.<ref name="features">http://www.downthemall.net/howto/features/</ref>
== Multi-part downloading ==
One of the main features of '''DownThemAll''' is the capability for multi-part download. This feature is similar to features in [[GetRight]] and [[Download Accelerator Plus]]. When enabled, this allows the user to download the file in pieces, then combining the pieces after a completed download; thus increasing the download speed when connected to a slow server.<ref name="features"/> 1.0b1 adds [[Metalink]] support which allows multiple URLs for each file to be passed to DTA, along with checksums and other information.<ref name="features"/>
== Download filtering ==
When extracting links from a page, the user may choose to download only specific files (for example: all pdfs) using [[wildcard character|wildcard]] or [[regular expression]] inclusive filters.<ref name="features"/>
